question.title: SpringToolSuite Database Connectivity Tool won't add Drivers
question.body:
I have the latest Spring Tool Suite (STS) 4.32.0 and 4.32.1. In both cases, I did manage to add the JBoss Tools to both versions. I have a basic SpringBoot starter project, and I have the Oracle Drivers, and the Spring Data JPA libraries in my maven pom.xml. I can absolutely access this database and it's tables from this app, that is not the question. I am working on a project where there is already an existing Entity and Repository layer which also 100% works and talks to the Dev Oracle database.

However, the entities need LOTS and LOTS of work. I want to start a new project where I reverse engineer the entities from the database rather than having to do the work manually. Manually would take forever, and I would rather shortcut the process.

So, using the STS Database Connectivity to reverse engineer is something I'd like to do, BUT, unfortunately STS is not agreeing with me. Whenever I try to add the new Driver Definition, it won't let me add any JARS at all, they are ALL greyed out. I know in my .m2/repository/com/oracle/jdbc I have drivers for ojdbc8 and ojdbc11, but I cannot for the life of me get Eclipse to let me add any drivers at all.

I seem to remember years back I had to add the Oracle or MySQL or PostgreSQL drivers to Eclipse itself so I would see something than the only H2 driver, but I can't find that now on the Internet. If I had to copy drivers into Eclipse, I would.

I cannot use IntelliJ at all, and I know there are other basic Hibernate tools, but I don't want to create a new project to just do a reverse engineering. That's really my last resolution short of hand coding tables myself. I just want to see what the Hibernate Tools determine to be a reasonable entity.

So, if there is either another tool to reverse engineer entities, or somewhat I can fix the STS Database Connectivity for their DataSource Explorer, that would be great.

question_comments.body: I added the tags for jboss-tools and the Eclipse Data Tools platform, since the database connectivity and reverse engineer entities features are not part of the standard Spring Tools for Eclipse distribution. Hope that makes people aware of this issue that are more familiar with this.
